Sentencas: This paper explores the gas-phase kinetics of butane and ethanol conversion as well as the propensity for molecular-weight growth and deposit formation in the non-catalytic regions of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: Experiments are done where the fuel flows through a quartz reactor heated by a furnace.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: The primary observables are the extent of fuel conversion and the amount of deposit formed on a YSZ disk placed at the end of the furnace.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: Experiments are performed at 700, 750 and 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: The residence times in the hot zone varied from 2 to 4 s. Ethanol is more reactive than butane, and almost all the ethanol is reacted at 750 degrees C whereas butane is completely reacted at 800 degrees C. Deposit formation is much larger for butane.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: These results are compared to predictions of a detailed kinetic model.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: Model predictions for the extent of fuel conversion and molecular-weight growth are in good agreement with the data for both fuels.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: Butane is predicted to be converted to the lighter hydrocarbons methane, ethylene, propylene and ethane.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: Hydrogen is also a significant product, especially at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: For ethanol, the product distribution is different with lower amounts of hydrocarbons while substantial quantities of water, ethylene, CO and H-2 are predicted.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: In ethanol pyrolysis there is no significant production of species with more than two carbon atoms, whereas propylene production is significant in butane pyrolysis.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: Modeling results suggest this is a major reason for increased deposit formation with butane.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions

Sentencas: Equilibrium calculations demonstrate that both the butane and ethanol systems are far removed from equilibrium.
Titulo: Comparison of conversion and deposit formation of ethanol and butane under SOFC conditions
